{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which drug is contraindicated in pregnancy, we need to refer to the relevant documents that discuss drug use during pregnancy and the classification of drugs. Document [1] mentions that the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) classifies drugs used in pregnancy into five categories: A, B, C, D, and X. Category X drugs are contraindicated in pregnancy. Document [5] provides the definitions of these categories. Category A drugs have no risk in human studies, Category B drugs have no risk in animal studies, Category C drugs have a risk that cannot be ruled out, Category D drugs have evidence of risk, and Category X drugs have demonstrated a risk to the fetus. Document [15] also discusses the classification of drugs and their effects on pregnancy. We need to find the specific drug mentioned in the question and determine its category.", "answer_choice": "D"}
